tune.name: Love is in the Air (32-bar Version)
tune.author: Nicolas “Niols” Jeannerod
tune.content:
\relative f' <<
  \new Voice {
    \clef treble
    \time 4/4
    \key d \major

    \repeat volta 2 {
      \partial 4 a4 |
      d,4 fis8 a b4 a |
      b8 a b cis d4 d8 cis |
      b4 d8 fis b a g fis |
      e d cis b a g fis e |
      \break

      d4 fis8 a b4 a |
      b8 a b cis d4 d8 cis |
      b4 d8 fis b a g fis |
      e d e fis d4
    } \break

    \repeat volta 2 {
      d8 e |
      fis4 a8 fis g fis e g |
      fis d b cis d cis b a |
      g a b cis d cis b a |
      a b cis d e fis g a |
      \break

      fis4 a8 fis g fis e g |
      fis d b cis d cis b a |
      g a b cis a b cis e |
      fis4 d d
    }
  }

  \new ChordNames {
    \chordmode {
      s4 |
      d2 g | a d | b:m e:m | a2 a:7 |
      d2 g | a d | b:m e:m | a2:7 d |

      d2 e:m | b1:m | g | a2 a:7 |
      d2 e:m | b1:m | g2 a:7 | d2.
    }
  }
>>
tune.composer-details:
This is how I initially composed as an AABB 32-bar reel, before I presented it
to Violaine Eysseric who liked it and asked to use it for her dance “Love is
in the Air”. For her dance, I play this tune as ABABAB for 48 bars.
